reviews.review_msg: One of the most straightforward lecturers Ive had for a math course. He gives pretty clear explanations but its honestly almost exactly the same as whats on the textbook so you could just as easily learn it on your own. However, hes kind (super patient when answering questions) and you can tell he really cares about his students!

She cares her students and tries to increase your grades. She always prepares sample test and exercises for us. However, she teaches not quite clear. I think TA taught better than her. The course material is also very hard, so you must work hard and go to ask TA when you have problems.

I didn't like her at first becuz she went too fast and I had no time to copy down notes, but over the semester, I found she was very helpful when I had any questions and went to see her in math workshop. I did learn a lot in this class and enjoyed her teaching style. Also, TAs were extremely helpful for this class. I'm thankful for all of them!

summer 2010: Nice and helpful -encourages thinking for hw Q's and not just give the soln-, had fill-in-the-blank notes -made attendance somewhat mandatory-, Midterms were not too hard, final was pretty simple, positive attitude during lectures, instructor Q for HW weren't too bad - had 1 or 2 challenging questions- reading the txtBook (Lay) helped

Lectures are very hectic, she goes too fast w/ messy writing. I learn more from the textbook (Lay). Midterms are hard, much harder than her sample MTs. Weekly homework can be tricky. Overall, avoid this prof and stick to Math 232.
She is really a good teacher. Easier to understand and easy to get marks for this course

The most engaging math teacher I've ever had.  Really enjoyed the class, even though I got a C+, although that was more because i was taking 5 courses and had to miss the first midterm, which was the easier one.

Karen Yeats is the worst professor I have ever had. Hard to understand, burns through notes, makes material very tough and is not engaging at all. She also a schizophrenic personality, which doesn't help. Do NOT take her class.

He is very knowledgeable and he explains the concepts very well. I understand why he spent so much time at the start of the semester to cement the foundational ideas for the rest of the course. However near the end he was going too fast. so he just needs to work on his time management. He gives fair exams and he's a good lecturer.

Like others have stated, time management was very poor, especially towards the end of the course. He made empty promises about filling in the powerpoints, and uploading them, causing us to not write anything to fill in his blank notes. He's very nice however, but probably would recommend filling in notes even if he says he'll upload them bc he wont

OK, I self-studied Linear Algebra by watching Yale open course video first, so I find this course kinda easy. Regarding the prof, his accent, well, is sexy, but makes me hard to follow, and I finally get used to his hand writing. He got a nice shape!

Honestly, this is my first time giving a rating to any professor and probably my last, but this professor truly deserves such great ratings. I have taken this course several semesters ago and failed miserably. Fortunately, this time around I came across such a  passionate prof who would explain concept in ways that normal people could understand.
the best professor in SFU. The exams are not tricky, the number of assignments questions are less than every other math professors. He's so nice,wish can take his courses later.
The best professor in SFU.
He liked talking about real life applications of math. Midterms and final were fair. He was a clear lecturer, but seemed disorganized. He is a good prof.
DeVos is the man! so much passion for the maths, great prof.

Wow, I've never seen such enthusiam from anyone! This man has a passion for mathematics and it shows. He makes the hardest concepts really simple. Midterm, were ok. But the final, aside from the proofs, was generally easy. Would definitely recommend taking any courses, if possible, with him!!
Like most linear algebra classes, lectures are pretty useless. Exams are quite fair and final is scaled well. Best to study on your own if you're doing math 240 or 232 in general.

Super nice and understanding prof. Made all her classes energetic and I can tell she likes what she teaches. Course was relatively easy, but I had some troubles in understanding and memorizing prooving stuff. Overall great lectures and fair exams.

Sophie teaches something in the lectures and tests something else on exams. Exam questions are fully based on theory and memorizing theorems. Rarely finishes lectures and ends up posting a video. This is proof based class, but she didn't want to teach the most important aspect in person so posted multiple videos on proving and advice was "Read".

Sophie really cares about her students, and does her best to help them out. She listened very well to feedback and was super understanding of small algebra mistakes that can happen, doing her best to limit how many marks were lost from those. She went out of her way to make extra videos students requested on stuff like proving. Great teacher
She explains well, answers questions well, and is sometimes funny

Kind and caring, passionate for math. The course was very good structured. I also feel she made the exams comparatively easier than other 240 profs. Some have mentioned that they don't really get her explanations, but it was not the case for me. Had to use both lectures and the textbook tho cause the course itself has a lot of material.

She's a pretty good prof, her lectures are easy to follow along with. Sometimes some things would be a lil bit confusing, but the next lecture usually cleared up any problems I had. Tests were all pretty fair, some proofs but they weren't that bad. Overall, she's chill

For MATH 240, Katrina Honigs is a great prof. It's clear she enjoys teaching the course, and she is very patient and accommodating. There's plenty of opportunity to learn something new, and to get help from the TAs in optional, daily workshop sessions.

On my first midterm I failed then on the other two I did great. Recommend going to office hours(you can also email her to meet if you're not able to go to office hours) if you're having problems with definitions and theorems. For my class she would put warm-up problems for the 1st 10 min of class or 10 min before class.

Katrina is very organized with her lecture notes and amazing prof! She is ready to help when I don't understand concepts and explains rather difficult concepts in lin alg very well. Tests were very fair and as long as you put in the work, your efforts will be shown in your mark.

The best thing about Katrina is that she's super organized. The syllabus schedule/timeline is detailed and followed on point. Weekly assignments with the exception of each midterm week (3 total). Lectures, assignments, exams—always 100% predictable, always fair, and always routine—as it should be. If you appreciate consistency, Katrina is perfect.

Hear me out, Katrina understands the importance of organization and access to class material. Not all of us can commit 4-5+ hrs in transit for a 1 hr lecture. If you're strong in math and self-motivated, you won't be held back or forced to attend and your time is respected. If you're reading this Katrina, please never change that about your class.

Dr.Honigs gave fair assessments and the textbook that she used was readable, yes her lectures weren't the best but that really is an excuse to do well in her class as she does provide the materials needed succeed in my opinion. At the end of the day she wants her students to succeed which is more than most profs can say.

Sometimes her lectures sometimes got confusing BUT she always redeemed herself the lecture after to clarify any confusion that might have resulted. She is great in office hours as well. I also like how she puts many of the problems we face in the class into "plain English" to help students make easier connections to how topics are presented.

She covers less than the bare minimum every class, wastes a lot of time with mentis, and gets derailed easily. Early in the course, she often pushed back material due to how slow we were getting through the curriculum, but she has gotten better at not doing this. 

Exams are fair, assignments are okay if you read the textbook. Notes are illegible.
Great intro to linear algebra, concepts explained clearly, and assignments give good practice
If you have the opportunity, take MATH 240 with this man. He is my goat.

He posted his notes which was nice but his lectures are just amazing. He was super prepared and the notes were easy to follow. The tests also weren't insanely hard, just understand the homework and the tests won't be too bad.

Horrendous prof who continuously overcomplicates the material and fails to reduce it to the most basic points for students to even understand. Definitely not worth the purported hype as the other users trumpet to be here.

Super nice guy, seems like he actually likes teaching. For the midterms, understand all the assignment questions as test questions are pulled from there. If you put effort into doing the assignments yourself this class will be a breeze

If you take MATH 240 with Prof. Monagan, you can learn about everything by attending lectures. Despite being optional, I highly recommend attending a lecture, as it's just a life-changing experience to attend such a high-quality lecture. Also, he assigns about 20-40 homework problems over an average 10-day period. It's all on the midterms.

What can I say that hasn't already been said. I wish he could teach all my classes. If MATH makes you uncomfortable, take any math class with Monagan. He will show you how easy it really is. He explains everything very clearly and makes math accessible. He laughs, he smiles. He genuinely cares about students. Best prof. i've had at SFU hands down.

MATH240 was a very difficult course for me, but Michael made the material so understandable. I enjoyed going to every single lecture, he is also very open to answering questions during OH/outside of class which was great. He is a really caring prof, if you have the chance to take any math course with him definitely do not pass on the opportunity.

I truly felt like I can't do Math anymore until I met Michael. He is my angel fr🥹 coming to heal my soul. He has such a nice accent that I was so into bcz I failed my Calc 2 as I can't listen and understand. His exam couldn't be fairer. And the best thingggg!!! He is so open and enthusiastic in his office hours even if it's over. He is caring fr🫶

Professor Monagan is a fantastic lecturer. The pace and the focus of the lectures is always excellent. You will learn a lot from just sitting in class and listening. He is also very well organized. Assignments and assignment solutions were always ready on time. I felt very well prepared for the tests and quizzes. You will learn in his class.

Best Math prof I've had at SFU. He's straightforward, has a sense of humour and he genuinely cares about the students. His exams, tests and assignments were fair. You can tell how passionate he was about the subject and he knows how to teach it. AMAZING PROF!
Great sense of dry, witty humour and amazing lecturer. There is marked homework but it is definitely the right quantity and quality of questions. The tests are very fair.

Very passionate about the subject. I especially liked the applications that we were taught, and the Maple code. He is very humble, and I feel like he has helped many students. Take a course with this professor! :)

This prof made me want to come to lecture, she genuinely wants us to understand and do well. Other comments are right that lectures can be disorganized at times, but she's always willing to double back if anyone is confused. Proof assignments sometimes had confusing grading, attend class for her written examples!

Very helpful outside of class at office hours, but I found the lectures and notes themselves to be very poorly organized. We would often be given the "key idea" to understanding a particular topic, but the surrounding details felt glossed over, making the idea effectively useless to know. I found the midterms to be very fair. 5/5 person 1/5 lecture

This is a great class and Nilima Nigam is a great professor. She explained a lot of hard stuff in a way such that people can understand and I benefitted a lot from it. Wish she also showed class averages for exams so we wouldn't be in the dark about how we're doing.
Great lectures, easy to understand. Assignments and quizzes were reasonable and helped practice the course content. The two midterms and final exam were tough, but fair.
Jake was great. The only office hours I have ever found useful.
Really great prof. Would highly recommend taking a class with him. Exams are definitely tough but grading is fair.

Dr. Bruin is a genius. He makes the boring algebra fascinating. Besides the materials he will also share a lot application of the concepts. He has the ability to let you know whether you should learn math if you are confused. I love him.

Worst prof I had. Learned the whole course by myself as his lectures makes the material more confusing than it needs to be. Hand writes all of his lecture notes in cursive so if you can't read cursive, good luck. Makes plenty of mistakes during lectures and just scribbles them out. He knows the content really well, just can't teach it.
Really humorous instructor. Sometimes he may make mistakes, but not a big deal. Mathematical genius will make tiny faults, can be understood.

Really nice teacher. Humorous and attractive class. He is definitely glad to help you with any problems. His teaching styles make this boring algebra fascinating. If there is a chance I would choose him again.
Great teacher.

Incredibly boring and unclear on the material.  I was confused and did most of my learning through the texbook/online.  Didn't like the course for a while but you just have to get used to the way of thinking that's required.  Exams/quizzes are super straightforward.  Finished with an easy A+ in this one.

Hard to understand, says pivot like "pie vot", aside from that he is pretty cool. Before each of the midterms, he would stop covering new material and focus and giving you the information you should be reviewing, and took questions on homework.

He is a very lazy prof, a nice guy though and certainly a genius. It seemed like he came to a few lectures without even looking at the slides before hand and just freestyled the proofs. If you do your homework and go to the workshop, you will be fine.

He lectures and uses the same material in the book.  His lecture is not that useful because the book does a better job at explaining the material.  Exams/midterms are very easy, just do you homework and read the book you should do just fine.  Good Luck!!!
5 for easiness cuz exams/midterms are just homework-level. read the text, do the homework and you should do well in this course.

I am very thankful for this prof as his exams are pretty easy... otherwise I will have an even tougher time this semester... I think he is a nice guy and just want you to learn the basic knowledge without expecting everyone to be a math geek...

Useless lectures. Notes are straightly from text but he can't explain them well. I have yet taken the final, but his midterms were pretty easy as long as you do the homework and read the text yourself.

Super good Prof for lin alg. I was worried about this course at first, but it ended up being quite straightforward and interesting! His exams are super fair, you have nothing to worry about if you do the HW. Quiz questions pulled straight from assignments. Solid lecturer and gives good balance of proofs and calculation/application!

Dr Fetecau gives clear explanations and is well-organized. Exams were fair. Goes quite fast in class, a bit difficult to keep up. Doesn't upload notes. Be ready to spend a lot of time studying for this course. I supplemented it with reading/practicing from the textbook closely and also watching videos that explain the intuition behind the concepts.

The course is bit challenging than Calculus but easy if you put efforts. The quizzes were straight out of homework assignments. We had two proof assignments which were pretty average. The exams weren't that difficult. Dr.Fetecau was really helpful and is a really good prof. He doesn't upload lecture notes so you need to go to the lectures.

Solid prof. He writes by hand in his lectures, which makes it easy to follow along. He does go a bit fast though so make sure you pay attention. His exams are fair and he's a cool guy.
Also,make sure to do all his assigned textbook questions, since his quizzes are pulled directly from those assignments.
GREAT PROF!
Total babe, I wish he weren't married.
GREAT PROFESSOR!!
Great teacher who is really funny. Goes through lectures too fast sometimes though.

Nice and funny guy to talk with in class and after. Although exams are not quite easy, it is still achievable to get a good grade just by practising more and comprehence the concepts and the ideas he gives us. Recommended for your exploration in maths!

This guy is easily one of the best math profs I've had so far, super caring and helpful. Math 240 however, is probably the hardest course I've taken so far. If you study the practice exams (basically memorize everything on them) and understand the first unit really well, you should easily pass. Doing textbook questions was very helpful too.

If you're not strong in math or have a busy semester, you probably shouldn't take this class, but if you do, study hard. Do all the questions from the textbook (look at the study guide too), take the time to learn the concepts by heart and DO NOT procrastinate. This course is built-off of the beginning concepts, if you don't get them, good luck.

Honestly I don't understand all the bad reviews. He has been EXTREMELY flexible and accommodating. He put together an extra proof note package and video, a big list of all the theorems with his own numbering, and an example pool just to help us. Lectures cover the basics and the textbook questions help reinforce concepts. Extremely hard course tho
Crazy how he believes students can wrong 3 proofs in under 10 minutes.
Midterms and final are not difficult as long as you understand the concept. He is generous on marking. However, you may need extra learning material (Youtube - 3Blue 1 Brown was helpful for me)
i don't recommend students at all! he is a way far from saying he is fit for this course but it's upto u. if u plan read the book urself and do well go for it.

There's only much 1 can go over in a 50 min lecture. He prepared and good notes which included the must knows. Accent wasn't clear and he could've some time on ways to approach proofs. Overall, prof did his job well. For such a proof oriented course, students cant expect to learn it all from the prof. Requires thinking and learning alone.
Once he got stuck when he's talking about one quiz problem, then he just kept thinking  until class is over and asked us to leave.
There's literally no need to attend lectures. He simply copies everything in the book to a piece of paper and read it out. Don't understand how this guy can be a professor
"Feel free  to leave if you think the class is boring" he said.....

He just regurgitates whatever is in the textbook, sometimes word for word. Yet he still manages to poorly explain the content. No point in going to class when you could just read the book yourself. Proofs are hard as balls, and the averages for our 2 midterms were both about 40%.  Even then he thinks the midterms were fair and that we're just dumb.
Not a very good professor

After the first lecture I lost hope in this guy. I stopped going to his lectures, but I heard from my friend that his post-midterm discussion is rough, and often makes fun of you for not getting easy and trivial proofs. Take this if you enjoy a challenge. :)

Stephen is a pretty average prof. He is willing to help and is always available during office hours but his lectures can be difficult to pay attention to because he writes so fast. Also, there was a large number of typos in the notes. I had other courses as my priorities but if I had focused a bit more I think I could've gotten in the B+/A- range.

Read the textbook, because it's really hard to learn in the lectures. Also, get help from the Algebra Workshop for your proofs assignments. Exams and quizzes are hard, but they do reflect the textbook questions. The prof make quiet a lot of typos and mistakes in class content.
